page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: THE EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS IN OUR AREA TODAY,ARE ONLY SIMILAR TO THEIR PREDECESSORS IN EXTERNAL APPEARANCES. IN THE 1820'S, MISS SAMBURN TAUGHT, (THOSE CHILDREN WHO COULD BE SPARED FROM SHAWL CUTTING),THE 3R'S IN HER OWN HOME. THAT THE BRIDES OF THE TIME COULD SIGN THEIR NAMES WHILE THE GROOMS COULD NOT, MUST BE TO HER CREDIT.BY 1840 A MISS CUSHING TAUGHT IN A SCHOOL ROOM PROVIDED BY A LOCAL PHILANTHROPIST. PUPILS PAID 1D A DAY FOR LESSONS. THE ORIGINAL SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN 1865, WHEN HOLIDAYS ARE RECORDED FOR BOYS TO PHEASANT BEAT AND TO CELEBRATE VICTORIA'S DIAMOND JUBILEE,AS WELL AS FESTIVALS AND HARVEST.THE SCHOOL BECAME A FIRST SCHOOL IN 1974 WHEN A NEW MIDDLE SCHOOL WAS BUILT TAKING PUPILS FROM FELTHORPE AND ST.FAITHS TOO. ATTENDANCE IS FREE, BUT COMPULSORY!
